summary: This document outlines the corporate account authorization and terms and conditions for the Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc. at Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. It details the powers granted to officers of the corporation, the responsibilities of the client, and the terms under which the account will operate, including provisions for arbitration and the handling of securities. This document outlines the Articles of Incorporation and By-Laws for the J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc., detailing the structure, management, and responsibilities of the Board of Trustees and officers. It includes the names and addresses of initial trustees and officers, as well as procedures for filling vacancies and managing the corporation's affairs. This document contains various legal and administrative details regarding the J. Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, including the election of officers, duties of those officers, and certification of the foundation's good standing in the Virgin Islands. It also includes correspondence from the Internal Revenue Service regarding the foundation's tax-exempt status.

keyFacts: The Epstein Virgin Islands Foundation, Inc. is established for charitable, educational, and scientific purposes.
The corporation is organized under the laws of the Virgin Islands.

The Corporation is managed by a Board of Trustees consisting of three members.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is named as the President of the Corporation.
